documents.document: 1. Perfect and adapt your personal commercial—learn to introduce yourself in an interesting and informative way. Let your listener know you’re job seeking and what you are looking for, but don’t harp on it. Include personal tidbits about yourself. Most importantly—use the introduction to get a dialogue started. Look for a common bond. 2. Listen [...]

We wish to everyone who has been a part of the 411 Career Doctors community this past year a happy and healthy holiday season. We look forward in 2011 to helping fellow professionals find that job that allows them to utilize their talents and strengths, to receive appropriate financial return and to experience personal fulfillment. Yep—we hear this “out with the old” phrase every January. Know what? It’s true. Based on what we keep seeing in your resumes, here are the top 5 things to stop doing now: Boring Objective statements Boring lists of responsibilities and tasks Boring rubber stamps (good communicator, trustworthy, loyal, team player) Boring complete sentences loaded [...]

What is more important: Hiding Your Age or Advertising Your Experience? Several times a month, I teach a workshop at a local career center about the basics of the website LinkedIn. We cover many topics, from constructing a profile to following companies to signing out of your account when you’re finished using a public computer. [...]

5 tools you need to go from being a “recent graduate” to a “recent hire.” Congratulations, you’ve earned your college degree! Employers should come knocking on your door any day now…right? Unfortunately, it’s not that easy. Your degree is a major accomplishment, but there is still work to be done before you will be ready [...]

5 Reasons to Join LinkedIn Before You Fill Out another Job Application Every second, two people sign up on the website LinkedIn. Therefore, while you were reading that first sentence, about 6 people joined. Overall, the site boasts 120 million members around the world. With numbers like those, you can’t help but wonder: What is [...]

Re-Igniting the Lost Art of Face-To-Face Networking It’s hard to imagine in this day and age, but there was a time long ago in which online networking didn’t exist.
